intro: Saussurea russowii, commonly known as the Tibetan corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, hairy stems and clusters of small, yellowish to brownish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, arid conditions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss. Saussurea russowii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens for its unique appearance.
